description.narrative: The Project is to construct and operate a new dedicated container terminal (the Terminal) within Puerto Quetzal. The Terminal will operate under a 25-year Contrato de Usufructo Oneroso (Usufruct Agreement) on leased land owned by Empresa Portuaria Quetzal, the state owned company that owns and administers Puerto Quetzal. The proposed financing would help execute Phase 1 investments required under the Usufruct Agreement and help create a container facility with an annual capacity of 340,000 twenty-foot container equivalent units (TEUs). At full build out, the Terminal will have an annual capacity of 700,000 TEUs and be able to handle post-panamax ships.

The construction of the terminal will contribute to increasing Guatemala''s competitiveness and trade by offering needed, modern and efficient container handling capacity to better serve the country''s exports and imports. It will also help facilitate trade with new markets (South America and Asia), as the Project will allow handling of post-panamax vessels and expand the existing port''s capacity for handling containers. The Project will also increase foreign direct investment in the country, generate new jobs, and generate new taxes for the local and state governments.

name.narrative: The Project is located within Puerto Quetzal, located on Guatemalas Pacific coast, approximately 1.5 hours drive from Guatemala City.
